page.title: 03Peacehaven
page.content: The name Peacehaven was given to a development of houses in this area after the Great War. The name was chosen as a result of a competition for a suitable home. The original development was along a coastal strip and later extended out towards Telscombe Village. The constant pressure for housing has led to more new housing estates to the north. During May/July 1985 the rate at which houses were being completed meant no figure could be agreed at for the number of houses in the area. Access to the area is by roads leading to the main south coast road although many residents work in Lewes to the north. This places pressure on the unofficial cross-country routes which run over private land or land under conservation orders.
